oh.translation[0].definitions[0].definit: used when you want to get someone’s attention or continue what you are saying
oh.translation[0].definitions[0].example: Oh, look, I think that’s Harry over there.
Milk, cereal, juice – oh, and put lettuce on the list too.
oh.translation[0].definitions[1].definit: used when you are giving an answer to a question
oh.translation[0].definitions[1].example: ‘Have you met his wife?’ ‘Oh, yes, I know her quite well.’
‘I hope Jenny won’t be angry.’ ‘Oh, no, don’t worry about that.’
‘Can you lend me ten pounds?’ ‘Oh, all right, but only until tomorrow.’
oh.translation[0].definitions[2].definit: used to make a slight pause when you are speaking
oh.translation[0].definitions[2].example: I met your friend in town, oh, what’s her name?
oh.translation[0].definitions[3].definit: used to show that you are very happy, angry, disappointed etc about something
oh.translation[0].definitions[3].example: Oh, no! I’ve left my keys in the car!
Oh, God, I forgot all about it!
oh.translation[0].definitions[4].definit: used to show that you are surprised about something
oh.translation[0].definitions[4].example: ‘Frances has left her husband, you know.’ ‘Oh, has she?’
